intro: Nastus lokohoensis, commonly known as the Lokoho nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant features showy yellow flowers with four petals, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Nastus lokohoensis is adapted to grow in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
